item.title: blog using org and hugo
item.description: References : https://ddavis.io/ Copied shamelessly from here* https://seds.nl/ My ulitmate plan Questions : I have made a base site using hugo static generator. The post are written using the org-mode from emacs. Then the plugin `ox-hugo` converts the org file to markdown and places it to the posts folder of the hugo site. i have also used roam capture template so that the placeholder for tags and categories are perdefined in new org files.

item.title: pytorch learning path
item.description: Basics Sebastian : Perceptron CNN Architecture LeNet5 VGG GoogleNet/Inception v1 ResNet Image Neural Style Transfer Siamese Network NLP DL Models Recurrent Neural Network Bidirectional Recurrent Neural Network Pytorch Text Generator with character level LSTM TorchText 1 videos TorchText 2 videos TorchText 3 videos Pytorch Image Captioning Tutorial Object Detection Intersection over Union Non-Max Suppression Mean Average Precision YOLO from scratch Segmentation PyTorch Image Segmentation Tutorial with U-NET Implement Neural Style Transfer in Mobile Device Captioning With Attention GAN

item.title: ML Evaluations Score
item.description: references questions Accuracy Precision Precision = \(\frac{True Positive}{True Positive + False Positive}\) Recall Recall = \(\frac{True Positive}{True Positive + False Negative}\) F1 Score A harmonic mean between recall and precision Why ? Tries to give the lowest value between recall and precision biased to the lowest value Balances recall and precision F1 Score = \(\frac{2}{\frac{1}{Precision} + \frac{1}{Recall}}\)

item.title: image_segmentation
item.description: referencees : questions : Using Deep Learning UNET Image Segmentation Loss/ Evaluation Method Problem with other common metrics We need metrics that target pixels in foreground Intersection over union Overall accuracy is not a good metric for semantic segmentation, especially for imbalanced dataset IOU = \(\frac{Intersection}{Union}\) = \(\frac{\sum{\hat{y}*y}} {\sum{\hat{y} + y - \hat{y} * y}}\) Dice Score Easy to differentiate For Image = \(\frac{2*\sum{\hat{y}*y}} {\sum{\hat{y} + y}}\) priortise both precision and recall equally Loss = 1 - Dice Carvana Log Fixed the bit mask and operation while passing the tensor The dice score on whole training dataset was calculated, 0.

item.title: xgboost
item.description: publish date : 18 jan 2021 review date : 28 feb 2021 references : XGBoost Part 1 (of 4): Regression XGBoost Part 3 Math Details Stat Quests Questions : What is log odds, from log odds to probability Machine Learning Algorithm for regression and classification problems. For Regression Similarity score = \(\frac{ { \text{Sum of residuals, Squared} } } {\text{number of residuals}+ \lambda} }\) Gain to determine how to split the data (Gain should be high) Gain = \(Left_{similarity} + Right_{similarity} - Root_{similarity}\) Pruning the tree by calculating the difference between Gain and the tree complexity Parameter, \(\gamma\) (Gamma).
